issue.description:
The current capability for add, change, delete are too limiting to support existing delta eda structures.
There is a need to identify an aggregate in addition to a product definition to which an item is to be added, deleted.
Example: Add a terminal to Physical_connectivity_definition.associated_terminals
Example: Delete a terminal from Generic_physical_network.connectivity_requirement_element

comment.description:
Here is the list of specific things normal EDA design changes file supports:
Add a component to a design, Delete a component from a design, Rename an existing component (ref des), Change the location, orientation of a component, Change the definition of a component, Chagne the catalog data of a component (part actually), Add a terminal to a functional unit node, physical connectivity definition, or parts connected terminal definition, or a physical net. Delete a terminal to a functional unit node, physical connectivity definition, or parts connected terminal definition, or a physical net. Merge two of functional unit node, physical connectivity definition, or parts connected terminal definition, or a physical net into one of those (keeping the type the same). Create a new functional unit node, physical connectivity definition, or parts connected terminal definition, or a physical net. Split one of functional unit node, physical connectivity definition, or parts connected terminal definition, or a physical net into two of functional unit node, physical connectivity definition, or parts connected terminal definition, or a physical net (keeping the same types).
rename an existing functional unit node, physical connectivity definition, or parts connected terminal definition, or a physical net.
change the pin-swap and other properties of a terminal.
Add, delete or change the value of a property on components, nets, terminals.
change the values of the context properties for shape (i.e., physical-unit_planar_shape.environment). Moved to bugzilla
